refnamediv.refpurpose:
subarray
array reductions
subarray Produce a result array by selecting a contiguous area of cells.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The subarray operator accepts an input array and a set of coordinates specifying a region within the array. The result is an array whose shape is defined by the boundary coordinates specified by the subarray arguments.

listitem.para: The number of coordinate pairs in the input must be equal to the number of dimensions in the array.
The dimensions in the result array begin at 0, even if the dimensions in the input array do not.

informalexample.para: This example selects the values from the last two columns and the last two rows of a 4×4 array.

step.para:
Create an array called m4x4:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m4x4 <val:double>[i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0];

Return an array containing the cells that were in both the last two columns and the last two rows on m4x4:
AFL% subarray(m4x4,2,2,3,3); [ [(10),(11)], [(14),(15)] ]
